subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods managed it all — the wind blowing, the sand swirling and the photographers clicking.He shot a one-under-par 71 Friday, making birdies on two of the last three holes, for a one-stroke lead halfway through the Dubai Desert Classic. Woods was at eight-under 136. He also won in Dubai in 2006. Damien McGrane, who is ranked 319th and has never won as a professional, shot a 69 and was a stroke behind. He will be paired with Woods in the third round Saturday at Emirates Golf Club.Wind gusts reaching 30 miles an hour shook the bunkers and desert terrain. Sand flew in faces and created a haze masking many of the skyscrapers usually seen towering over the course. Woods wore sunglasses but said he was still “chewing sand all day.”The defending champion, Henrik Stenson of Sweden, shot a 70 and was two strokes behind. He shared third place with Thomas Levet of France, who had a 71.
